visual_elements.composition_type: Medium shot (shows the torso and hands of a person, focusing on product use rather than a full body or close-up of a face)

human_presence.expressions: Face not visible; focus is on hands in action, posture suggests instructional/neutral tone
human_presence.demographics: Adult, possibly female, light to medium skin tone, wearing a textured pink cardigan and white top

main_objects_props_featured: Green tube labeled 'Good Clean Love' (presumably 'Restore' gel)
Green branded product box in background
visual_elements.background_environment: Modern, tidy bathroom setting with white walls, round brown mirror, gold fixtures, plant décor

visible_text: (tube and box, but small and partially readable)

font_characteristics.style: Sans-serif, bold for 'Step three', regular for rest
font_characteristics.emphasis: 'Step three' is in large, bold white font; instructional text is in regular, black font
font_characteristics.color: 'Step three' is white (upper right), 'Fill applicator with 4g of Restore®' is black (center right)

text_placement_within_frame.'Fill applicator with 4g of Restore\u00a: Middle right, adjacent to 'Step three', smaller font

visual_metaphors_symbols: Clean bathroom environment for hygiene and trust
Green coloration on product for ‘natural’ or ‘healing’ associations
clickbait_techniques_employed: Step-by-step instruction implies practical value and demystifies a potentially sensitive topic
brand_elements_present: Good Clean Love logo and product packaging
Consistent color palette matching product branding

thumbnail_title_relationship.reinforcement: The thumbnail visually matches the title by explicitly showing the process of filling the applicator with the product, as referenced. The inclusion of the applicator, product tube, and 'Step three' on-screen text makes it clear this is a tutorial, aligning directly with the 'How to Attach Reusable Applicator to Restore® Tube' title.
thumbnail_title_relationship.contrasts_mismatches: Minor: The thumbnail specifically highlights filling the applicator (step 3), rather than the attachment process. However, this is contextually appropriate within a ‘how to attach/use’ instructional series.
